org.bhave.network.api

Interface Network


  • public interface Network

    Defines a network / graph data structure that contains Nodes with connections between them called edges or Links. This is just the interface to access and manipulate network structures provided by existing implementations.

    Node and Link objects should be created using the respective network instance using createNode and createLink methods. This avoids dealing with specific Node or Link implementations.

    Note: by creating a new node or link you are not adding them to the network. You still have to use addNode or addLink.



    Getting a Network Instance

    This library uses Guice to deal with network instance creation, hence, rather than worrying about specific implementations, a user can just request Network instances from Guice as follows:

    Injector injector = Guice.createInjector(new NetworkModule());
    Network network = injector.getInstance(Network.class);

    Author:
    Davide Nunes
    See Also:
    Node, Link, NetworkModule

    • Method Detail

      • addNode

        boolean addNode(Node node)
        Adds a node to the network. Fails if the node already exists or if the node is null.
        Parameters:
        node - the node to be added
        Returns:
        true if add is successful, false otherwise.

      • addLink

        Link addLink(Node node1,
           Node node2)
        Adds a Link to the graph. Fails if the Link is already in the Network, if the nodes do not exist in the network or if any of these elements is null.

        Note: the network is both directed and undirected by default. What this means is that if you wish to work with a directed network, the order of the given nodes dictates the direction of the link. If you wish to work with an undirected network, the order is not important, just use the methods that do not take link direction in consideration.
        Parameters:
        node1 - an existing node within the network
        node2 - an existing node within the network
        Returns:
        link a link if add is successful, null otherwise

      • addLink

        boolean addLink(Node node1,
              Node node2,
              Link link)
        Creates and adds a link to the network between the given nodes. Fails if the nodes do not exist in the network or if any of them is null.

        Note: the network is both directed and undirected by default. What this means is that if you wish to work with a directed network, the order of the given nodes dictates the direction of the link. If you wish to work with an undirected network, the order is not important, just use the methods that do not take link direction in consideration.
        Parameters:
        node1 - an existing node within the network
        node2 - an existing node within the network
        link - a link to be added from node1 to node2
        Returns:
        true if add is successful, false otherwise

      • removeNode

        boolean removeNode(Node node)
        Removes a node from the network. Fails if the node does not exist or if the node is null.

        Note:removing a node with existing links, also removes these links.
        Parameters:
        node - the node to be removed
        Returns:
        true if remove is successful, false otherwise

      • removeNode

        boolean removeNode(int id)
        Removes a node from the network based on its ID. Fails if the node does not exist. Note:removing a node with existing links, also removes these links.
        Parameters:
        id - the id of the node to be removed
        Returns:
        true if remove is successful, false otherwise

        Returns:

      • getLinks

        Parameters:
        node - the node from which we wish to extract the links from.
        Returns:
        a collection of links or null if this node does not exist in the network or is null.

      • getOutLinks

        java.util.Collection<? extends Link> getOutLinks(Node node)
        Returns a collection of links coming from the given node to other nodes. You should use this method if you are using the network as a directed network.
        Parameters:
        node - the node from which we wish to extract the links from.
        Returns:
        a collection of links or null if this node does not exist in the network or is null.

      • getInLinks

        java.util.Collection<? extends Link> getInLinks(Node node)

        Parameters:
        node - the node from which we wish to extract the links from.
        Returns:
        a collection of links or null if this node does not exist in the network or is null.
